column4: On radom occasions my monitor wont get any signal all of a sudden?
How do you get it to come back?
Did you try manhandling the monitor? ;P
Yeah, whacking the front sides if it's a CRT, or gently twisting the top (or slightly more the sides) if it's a TFT or LCD ;)
Usually I'd suggest opening a console and typing xrandr commands blindly, but you'd need to know how to open a terminal without the mouse, and find out how to use xrandr
well I just get no signal all of a sudden, cant boot up everything, though my PC is still running.

OK, another thing to try if that happens is ctrl-alt-backspace, which kills X (and any programs in it) and (perhaps) restarts it.  Since that usually changes the resolution etc. that might get you a signal back
Also worth trying  is a slightly lower resolution/refresh rate for a few days to see if the monitor can't sustain the resolution you currently use
OK.  In case you don't know already, if you're returned to a console you'll need to type 'startx' to get GUI running again.
